tfg.uo.lightpen.business.impl.networking.networktools

Class WakeOnLan

  • java.lang.Object
    • tfg.uo.lightpen.business.impl.networking.networktools.WakeOnLan

  • public class WakeOnLan
extends java.lang.Object
    * **** DISCLAIMER ***** * This is part of the AndroidNetworkTools library created by the user stealthcopter that can * be found here: https://github.com/stealthcopter/AndroidNetworkTools * We just integrated the source into our project to reuse part of their functionalities * ********************* Created by mat on 09/12/15.

    Tested this and it wakes my computer up :)

    Ref: http://www.jibble.org/wake-on-lan/

      • wake

        public void wake()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Synchronous call of the wake method. Note that this is a network request and should not be performed on the UI thread
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Thrown from socket errors

      • wake

        public void wake(WakeOnLan.WakeOnLanListener wakeOnLanListener)
        Asynchronous call of the wake method. This will be performed on the background thread and optionally fire a listener when complete, or when an error occurs
        Parameters:
        wakeOnLanListener - - listener to call on result

      • sendWakeOnLan

        public static void sendWakeOnLan(java.lang.String ipStr,
                                 java.lang.String macStr)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Send a Wake-On-Lan packet to port 9 using default timeout of 10s
        Parameters:
        ipStr - - IP String to send to
        macStr - - MAC address to wake up
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - invalid ip or mac
        java.io.IOException - - error sending packet
